column30: SPOUTS   In this world of   as fine a pair of breasts   as ever I saw   the fountain in   Madison Square   spouts up of water   a white tree   that dies and lives   as the rocking water   in the basin   turns from the stonerim   back upon the jet   and rising there   reflectively drops down again.
